channel.title: [PI] How do I make monsters drop items?
channel.description:
I added this code to the bottom of my NPCDrops.TSM file: [code]#Bouncer 296:100 2478:5 275:1[/code]
I compiled with absolutely no errors. When I went to run my server, before it went online, this code came up: [code]java.util.NoSuchElementException: No Line found at java.util.Scanner.nextLine(Scanner.java:1516) at Server.model.npcs.NPCDrops.LoadDrops(NPCDrops.java:37) at server.model.npcs.NPCDrops.<init>(NPCDrops.java:15) at server.Server.<clinit>(server.java:70) [6/4/11 2:23 AM]: Launching Torvapkz in 3... 3... 1... Starting...Now! [6/4/11 2:23 AM]: Server listening on port 0.0.0.0:43594[/code]
If anyone could at least tell me what this means, or how I can fix it, please do, as I have not been able to find a fix for this the past few days.

item.title: [PI] How do I make monsters drop items?
item.dc:creator: @tztk tztk
item.description:
@tztk wrote:

Heres what I have for LoadDrops

[code]public class NPCDrops {

public NPCDrops() {
	loadDrops();
}



public static HashMap<Integer, int[][]> normalDrops = new HashMap<Integer, int[][]>();
public static HashMap<Integer, int[][]> rareDrops = new HashMap<Integer, int[][]>();
public static HashMap<Integer, int[]> constantDrops = new HashMap<Integer, int[]>();
public static HashMap<Integer, Integer> dropRarity = new HashMap<Integer,Integer>();

public void loadDrops() {
	try {
		int[][][] npcDrops = new int [62585][][];
		int[][][] rareDrops2 = new int [62585][][];
		int[] itemRarity = new int [62585];
		File f = new File("./Data/cfg/NPCDrops.TSM");
		Scanner s = new Scanner(f);
		while (s.hasNextLine()) {
			String line = s.nextLine();
			if (line.startsWith("#"))
				continue;
			StringTokenizer normalTok = new StringTokenizer(line, "\t");
			line = s.nextLine();
			if (line.startsWith("#"))
				continue;
			StringTokenizer rareTok = new StringTokenizer(line, "\t");
			String[] information = normalTok.nextToken().split(":");
			int npcId = Integer.parseInt(information[0]);
			itemRarity[npcId] = Integer.parseInt(information[1])-1;
			npcDrops[npcId] = new int[normalTok.countTokens()][2];
			rareDrops2[npcId] = new int[rareTok.countTokens()][2];
			int count = 0;
			while (normalTok.hasMoreTokens()) {
				String[] temp = normalTok.nextToken().split(":");
				npcDrops[npcId][count][0] = Integer.parseInt(temp[0]);
				npcDrops[npcId][count][1] = Integer.parseInt(temp[1]);
				count++;
			}
			count = 0;
			while (rareTok.hasMoreTokens()) {
				String[] temp = rareTok.nextToken().split(":");
				rareDrops2[npcId][count][0] = Integer.parseInt(temp[0]);
				//System.out.println("Raredrop: " + count + " " + rareDrops2[npcId][count][0]);
				rareDrops2[npcId][count][1] = Integer.parseInt(temp[1]);
				//System.out.println("Raredrop: " + count + " " + rareDrops2[npcId][count][1]);
				count++;
			}
			normalDrops.put(npcId, npcDrops[npcId]);
			rareDrops.put(npcId, rareDrops2[npcId]);
			dropRarity.put(npcId, itemRarity[npcId]);
		}
		loadConstants();
	} catch (Exception e) {
		e.printStackTrace();
	}	
}[/code]

Read full topic

What?

[quote=“tztk, post:12, topic:404346”]okay, here is my code now:

#Bouncer 269:100 2478:5 275:1
But still when I attack I get either nothing or random charms. any way to fix?[/quote]
make sure loadDrops(); is enabled

item.title: [PI] How do I make monsters drop items?
item.dc:creator: @Vexillum Vexillum
item.description:
@Vexillum wrote:

[quote=“tztk, post:10, topic:404346”]okay i’m recieving no error now, but when I kill the monster I added drops to I don’t get the drops I added? here is my code:

#Bouncer 296:1 2478:5 275:1

Is that the right way to make it drop 100% of the time?[/quote]

Look, the first part 296:1 the “296” is the npc id and the “1” is the drop percentage. So if you wanted it to be 100% drop rate you would change 296:1 to 296:100

Read full topic

item.source: [PI] How do I make monsters drop items?

item.title: [PI] How do I make monsters drop items?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:4, topic:404346”][quote author=ExtremeX-Scape™ link=topic=501391.msg3668381#msg3668381 date=1310756042]
Lol, It’s not a java file, there’s no need to compile when editing data file’s
[/quote]

That may be true, but due to the nature of the current “config loader” you do need to restart the server to load the changes.

(Hint: Use a command to reload the config so you don’t have to restart)

@OP: Make sure you’re using the tabs/spaces appropriately. Although, that error seems to indicate that there are no lines to be read at all from the file.[/quote]
Yes you do have to restart, and do what Zyle said, use a command, much simpler.
And yes make sure you use tab’s

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] How do I make monsters drop items?

item.title: [PI] How do I make monsters drop items?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

ExtremeX-Scape™:

Lol, It’s not a java file, there’s no need to compile when editing data file’s

That may be true, but due to the nature of the current “config loader” you do need to restart the server to load the changes.

(Hint: Use a command to reload the config so you don’t have to restart)

@OP: Make sure you’re using the tabs/spaces appropriately. Although, that error seems to indicate that there are no lines to be read at all from the file.
